definition: to hold back one's troops without moving (idiom); to bide one's time
to press/to push/to leave aside or shelve/to control/to restrain/to keep one's hand on/to check or refer to/according to/in the light of/(of an editor or author) to make a comment
soldiers/a force/an army/weapons/arms/military/warlike/CL:個|个[ge4]
(negative prefix)/not/no
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Just hesitate a little, still bide one's time.
sentences.chinese: 林文犹豫了一下，仍然按兵不动。

sentences.english: We shall wait the enemy out, and watch them starve.
sentences.chinese: 我们将按兵不动，等着敌人断粮挨饿。

sentences.english: The dogs began to yip and howl, but tonight they kept their places.
sentences.chinese: 狗也摆好阵势，要狂吠了，但是今晚，他们按兵不动。

definition: to act blindly without thinking (idiom)
defensive position/guard
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
to withdraw troops/to retreat
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
to wait for the opportune moment before taking action (idiom)
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to look for an opportunity
to reinforce/to increase troop numbers/reinforcements/extra troops
(idiom) to hesitate/to remain undecided
to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue
to withdraw troops/to retreat
to wait for an opportunity/to watch for one's chance
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
to give up defending/to yield/to surrender
